From: "Jason Rogers" <jason.rogers@...>

 
    > 1. Code coverage analysis should be your guide in making 
    > decisions about
    > whether testing through public APIs provide thorough 
    > enough test coverage
    > (80%? 95%?, depending on the quality you're shooting for 
    > and (relevant to
    > that) the industry you're in).  Naturally, coverage 
    > analysis will inform
    > your testing decisions, which in turn will likely inform 
    > your design
    > decisions.

Well put!  This is something I have often alluded to in my own company, but
still eludes me frequently.  For that reason I wrote a utility that
integrates with VAJ to keep the metrics coming as far as what is tested and
what is not.  This is not a code coverage analysis; all it does is report on
which classes are tested and which are not, and of the ones that are - how
much of their public interface is tested.

Thanks for the thoughts Scott.

-Jason
subject: RE: [junit] Best Practice for Tests ?
